#summary The window.clearTimeout stops the execution of delayed code.
#labels about-dom,is-dom-method

The window.clearTimeout function halts the possible execution of code initialized with either the [WindowSetTimeoutMethod window.setTimeout] or [WindowSetIntervalMethod window.setInterval] methods.

The passed in timerId can be null, though no action will result.  This can be useful for blind clearing timeouts that may not have been set.

== Arguments ==
  * timerId: Id returned from [WindowSetTimeoutMethod window.setTimeout] or [WindowSetIntervalMethod window.setInterval]. 
== Usage ==
{{{
var timerId = window.setTimeout("alert('this will not be called", 100);
window.clearTimeout(timerId);

//Alternate Syntax
clearTimeout(timerId);
}}}
